meanings.definition: Not capable of living or developing successfully.
meanings.sent1: The nonviable seed could not grow into a plant.
meanings.sent2: The scientist determined that the nonviable experiment was doomed to fail.
meanings.sent3: The nonviable idea of flying cars made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of becoming a famous singer was as nonviable as a fish riding a bicycle.
meanings.sent5: The nonviable plan to build a house out of marshmallows quickly melted away.

meanings.definition: Not capable of working, functioning, or succeeding.
meanings.sent1: The nonviable machine could not complete the task.
meanings.sent2: The business decided to shut down the nonviable branch.
meanings.sent3: The nonviable attempt at juggling oranges ended in a mess.
meanings.sent4: His nonviable plan to win the race crashed and burned.
meanings.sent5: The nonviable bridge collapsed under the weight of the cars.
